transcript: â€‰ British designer Alexander McQueen attends the press conference for the 1st Edition of Marie Claire Magazine Fashion Awards at Hotel Villamagna on November 18, 2003 in Madrid, Spain Source: Carlos Alvarez/ 1 hour ago Luke Newton may be famed for playing Colin Bridgerton (younger brother of Jonathan Bailey's Lord Anthony Bridgerton) on the Netflix period costume drama, but he's about to take on a whole new role â€“ that of decidedly more modern, and openly gay, fashion designer Alexander McQueen. The 32-year-old English actor will portray the late London-born designer in the play "House of McQueen" by Darrah Cloud. The Off Broadway play is set to "begin previews August 19 at The Mansion at Hudson Yards, with an official opening set for September 9," Deadline reported, with direction by Sam Helfrich. In addition to being a new play, "House of McQueen" "will be the first production at the new Hudson Yards, Manhattan, venue," Deadline noted. The play's website describes the new stage work as being "about the life and work of iconic fashion designer Alexander McQueen as told from his own revolutionary, daring and elegant perspective." "It is the story of a boy born in the east end of London, who literally wears his heart on his sleeve, never meant to rise beyond his working-class family," the description continues. "From making doll clothes for his mother's friends to working in a tailor shop, he rises to the top of the fashion industry as chief designer for Givenchy and head of his own legendary fashion line, as his fashion shows become theatrical and artistic spectacles, attracting countless celebrities." "Seeking to find beauty in the most devastating aspects of life, McQueen envisions and creates clothes to empower women in response to what is happening in his life and the world around him," the site says. "Fighting against the commercial interests of legendary houses like Givenchy and Gucci to remain provocative, he challenges norms and pushes boundaries as an artist." "In the end, the fight consumes him," the description summarizes. McQueen died in 2010 at the age of 40. McQueen became known for his low-rise jeans, called "bumsters," as well as for his provocative designs and runway shows. He designed for recording stars like Lady Gaga â€“Â who wore his famed "armadillo shoes" â€“ BjÃ¶rk, and David Bowie. McQueen's bold designs and dramatic fashion shows excited the fashion world but also led to allegations of misogyny, though the designer himself said he wished to "empower women" with his clothes. Deadline quoted Rick Lazes, who serves as an executive producer for the production, calling it an "absolute pleasure to announce Luke's involvement with 'House of McQueen'" and praising Newton as an "incredibly impressive multi-hyphenate." Aside from "Bridgerton" â€“ the fourth season of which is expected to arrive at Netflix next year â€“ Newton "recently wrapped production on the upcoming sci-ï¬ thriller 'White Mars,' opposite Lucy Hale," Deadline noted. by Kilian Melloy , EDGE Staff Reporter Kilian Melloy serves as EDGE Media Network's Associate Arts Editor and Staff Contributor. His professional memberships include the National Lesbian & Gay Journalists Association, the Boston Online Film Critics Association, The Gay and Lesbian Entertainment Critics Association, and the Boston Theater Critics Association's Elliot Norton Awards Committee.

cleaned_transcript: British designer Alexander McQueen attends the press conference for the 1st Edition of Marie Claire Magazine Fashion Awards at Hotel Villamagna on November 18, 2003 in Madrid, Spain Source: Carlos Alvarez/ 1 hour ago Luke Newton may be famed for playing Colin Bridgerton (younger brother of Jonathan Bailey's Lord Anthony Bridgerton) on the Netflix period costume drama, but he's about to take on a whole new role â€“ that of decidedly more modern, and openly gay, fashion designer Alexander McQueen. The 32-year-old English actor will portray the late London-born designer in the play "House of McQueen" by Darrah Cloud. The Off Broadway play is set to "begin previews August 19 at The Mansion at Hudson Yards, with an official opening set for September 9," Deadline reported, with direction by Sam Helfrich. In addition to being a new play, "House of McQueen" "will be the first production at the new Hudson Yards, Manhattan, venue," Deadline noted. The play's website describes the new stage work as being "about the life and work of iconic fashion designer Alexander McQueen as told from his own revolutionary, daring and elegant perspective." "It is the story of a boy born in the east end of London, who literally wears his heart on his sleeve, never meant to rise beyond his working-class family," the description continues. "From making doll clothes for his mother's friends to working in a tailor shop, he rises to the top of the fashion industry as chief designer for Givenchy and head of his own legendary fashion line, as his fashion shows become theatrical and artistic spectacles, attracting countless celebrities." "Seeking to find beauty in the most devastating aspects of life, McQueen envisions and creates clothes to empower women in response to what is happening in his life and the world around him," the site says. "Fighting against the commercial interests of legendary houses like Givenchy and Gucci to remain provocative, he challenges norms and pushes boundaries as an artist." "In the end, the fight consumes him," the description summarizes. McQueen died in 2010 at the age of 40. McQueen became known for his low-rise jeans, called "bumsters," as well as for his provocative designs and runway shows. He designed for recording stars like Lady Gaga â€“ who wore his famed "armadillo shoes" â€“ BjÃ¶rk, and David Bowie. McQueen's bold designs and dramatic fashion shows excited the fashion world but also led to allegations of misogyny, though the designer himself said he wished to "empower women" with his clothes. Deadline quoted Rick Lazes, who serves as an executive producer for the production, calling it an "absolute pleasure to announce Luke's involvement with 'House of McQueen'" and praising Newton as an "incredibly impressive multi-hyphenate." Aside from "Bridgerton" â€“ the fourth season of which is expected to arrive at Netflix next year â€“ Newton "recently wrapped production on the upcoming sci-ï¬ thriller 'White Mars,' opposite Lucy Hale," Deadline noted. by Kilian Melloy , EDGE Staff Reporter Kilian Melloy serves as EDGE Media Network's Associate Arts Editor and Staff Contributor. His professional memberships include the National Lesbian & Gay Journalists Association, the Boston Online Film Critics Association, The Gay and Lesbian Entertainment Critics Association, and the Boston Theater Critics Association's Elliot Norton Awards Committee.

transcript: â€‰ The Prince and Princess of Wales posed ahead of the state banquet with France's president at Windsor Castle Janine Henni Link copied Andrew Parsons / Kensington Palace Kate Middleton and Prince William in a portrait released on July 9, 2025 NEED TO KNOW Kate Middleton and Prince William served a surprise with their latest portrait The Prince and Princess of Wales, both 43, snapped the photo ahead of the state banquet at Windsor Castle, where they helped host France's first couple For the evening event, the couple got glam for the white-tie dress code, with Princess Kate sporting her first tiara in a year and a half Kate Middleton and Prince William's regal new portrait marks a departure from previous similar pictures, all thanks to the setting. On July 8, the Prince and Princess of Wales released a new photo of themselves dressed up for the state banquet at Windsor Castle, celebrating the state visit from France. "Ready for what promises to be a wonderful State Banquet this evening in Windsor," their team wrote below the portrait shared to the couple's official social media accounts, adding emojis of the French flag and Great Britain's Union Jack. The Prince and Princess of Wales, both 43, were the picture of royal elegance in their white-tie attire and royal regalia, where William sported a black tailcoat and Kate wore a red gown with cape by Sarah Burton (her bridal gown designer) for Givenchy. Andrew Parsons / Kensington Palace Kate Middleton and Prince William in a portrait released on July 9, 2025. The image also revealed Princess Kate's tiara return for the first time since 2023, but that wasn't the only striking aspect. Switching things up, the picture of the Prince and Princess of Wales, credited to Andrew Parsons, was snapped outdoors. Royal portraits commemorating formal occasions like state visits are traditionally taken indoors in settings like state rooms, so it was different for William and Kate to capture such a snap outside. The shot showed them standing close together before a bucolic background below the summer sun. The Prince and Princess of Wales live close to Windsor Castle with their children, Prince George, 11, Princess Charlotte, 10, and Prince Louis, 7, meaning that the diplomatic dinner didn't take them far from home. The couple could have gotten ready at their Adelaide Cottage home and taken the picture there before heading out, or they may have snapped it elsewhere within the vast grounds of Windsor Castle. The Windsor estate covers 15,800 acres, a vast holding that includes the public Windsor Great Park and the private Home Park, where the royal family's ancestral castle is. Chris Jackson/Getty Prince William and Kate Middleton attend the state banquet at Windsor Castle on July 8, 2025. Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! In a twist, the latest portrait of William and Kate is actually the second photo that they have recently released in connection with a major event that was taken outside. Following the Trooping the Colour festivities organized in King Charles' honor on Jun 14, the couple shared a family photo snapped on steps. The Prince and Princess of Wales/Instagram Princess Charlotte, Kate Middleton, Prince Louis, Prince George and Prince William in a picture released on June 14, 2025. "Another brilliant day at Trooping the Colour for His Majesty's Birthday Parade," read the caption of the snap showing the Wales family wearing their outfits from parade day. "Thank you to everybody who came, and to all those who took part." Read the original article on People

transcript: â€‰ Numerator's research on the first two days of the event found that 30 percent of shoppers are clicking on apparel or footwear, tying with household essentials. Amazon's mini Christmas in July has consumers clicking on fashion â€” and there are more apparel brands in the promotional mix, including vintage designer style from ReBag as well as looks from Michael Kors, Naadam and more. Prime Day, which extended to four days this year and ends on Friday, has become a fixture on the retail calendar, prompting competing deals from other retailers. Altogether, retailers are expected to see $23.8 billion in sales, or the equivalent of two Black Fridays, according to Adobe. At Amazon, the event has had a strong fashion start. Numerator is tracking the e-commerce giant's Prime Day take, studying the activity of shoppers at 22,411 households and surveying 2,248 buyers during the sale's first two days. Thirty percent of buyers snatched up Prime Day apparel and footwear â€” tying for the top spot with cleaning products and other household essentials, according to the data and tech company. But in keeping with the general sense of caution in the market, consumers are being very calculated as they spend. Fifty-one percent of shoppers bought items that they'd been waiting to buy on sale and 37 percent of shoppers bought the same items they typically buy on Amazon. Numerator pegged the average order size on Prime Day at $57.12 and said 51 percent of households have made two or more orders, upping the average household spend to $126.26. Two-thirds of the Prime Day items have sold for under $20 while only 3 percent are over $100. Amazon has been steadily adding to its fashion mix and a company spokesperson pointed to the slate of fashions making their Prime Day debut. For the first time, the luxury resale player Rebag is offering price promotions on looks from Alexander McQueen, ChloÃ©, Delvaux, Givenchy, Jacquemus, Valentino Garavani, Versace and Tom Ford on Amazon. And a host of brands have joined the rush this year and included select items in the event, such as HervÃ© LÃ©ger, Kate Barton, Calzedonia, Vans, Michael Kors and Naadam.

Amazon's mini Christmas in July has consumers clicking on fashion â€” and there are more apparel brands in the promotional mix, including vintage designer style from ReBag as well as looks from Michael Kors, Naadam and more. Prime Day, which extended to four days this year and ends on Friday, has become a fixture on the retail calendar, prompting competing deals from other retailers. Altogether, retailers are expected to see $23.8 billion in sales, or the equivalent of two Black Fridays, according to Adobe. At Amazon, the event has had a strong fashion start. Numerator is tracking the e-commerce giant's Prime Day take, studying the activity of shoppers at 22,411 households and surveying 2,248 buyers during the sale's first two days. Thirty percent of buyers snatched up Prime Day apparel and footwear â€” tying for the top spot with cleaning products and other household essentials, according to the data and tech company. But in keeping with the general sense of caution in the market, consumers are being very calculated as they spend. Fifty-one percent of shoppers bought items that they'd been waiting to buy on sale and 37 percent of shoppers bought the same items they typically buy on Amazon. Numerator pegged the average order size on Prime Day at $57.12 and said 51 percent of households have made two or more orders, upping the average household spend to $126.26. Two-thirds of the Prime Day items have sold for under $20 while only 3 percent are over $100. Amazon has been steadily adding to its fashion mix and a company spokesperson pointed to the slate of fashions making their Prime Day debut. For the first time, the luxury resale player Rebag is offering price promotions on looks from Alexander McQueen, ChloÃ©, Delvaux, Givenchy, Jacquemus, Valentino Garavani, Versace and Tom Ford on Amazon. transcript: â€‰ PEOPLE in 10 unpacks the best of the week â€” with a superlative twist! â€” from celebrity engagements and breakups to royals, style, baby news, and more. Plus, an expert PEOPLE editor answers the burning question of the week, and one of our favorite stars joins us for a sitdown. This week: Kaylee Goncalves' family plans to return money raised on GoFundMe after Bryan Kohberger's guilty plea, Coast Guard rescue swimmer reveals what inspired him to rescue 165 people in Texas floods, Kim Kardashian remembers her late childhood friend Lindsay May Palevsky on her birthday, and Dwyane Wade's mom gets candid about her incarceration's effect on her children. PLUS: Princess Kate debuts chic Christian Dior and Givenchy looks for French President Emmanuel Macron's state visit, Cardi B stuns with multiple avant-garde wardrobe changes at Paris Haute Couture Fashion Week as Schiaparelli's beating heart necklace goes viral, Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom reunite after announcing their split to vacation with their daughter on Jeff Bezos' superyacht, Monica Barbaro and Andrew Garfield hard launch their relationship at Wimbledon, and Katie Holmes likes a post about her ex-husband Tom Cruise spending time with Ana de Armas. Watch new episodes every Thursday at 10 a.m. ET / 7 a.m. PT with host Makho Ndlovu.

transcript: â€‰ She paired the metallic heels with a beaded Loewe dress. Vanessa Kirby stepped into shine and structure for Thursday's London premiere of â€œThe Fantastic Four: First Steps,â€ wearing Aquazzura's Minute Sandal 105 in metallic silver â€” the latest entry in her sculptural maternity footwear streak.QUES The Italian-made stilettos featured mirrored leather uppers, two slim straps and a high, tapered heel. A back zip created a clean finish at the ankle, and the brand's signature gold plaque was visible on the sole. The 105mm silhouette added lift without disrupting the overall proportion. Related Stories Kirby paired the sandals with a beaded turquoise dress from Loewe's spring 2025 collection. The strapless midi-length look, styled by Andrew Mukamal, was constructed entirely of layered bead strands that created fringe-like movement across the body. The runway version featured a shorter hemline and metallic underlayer, but Kirby's custom iteration removed any lining to emphasize the vertical drape. Combined with the clean stiletto, the full look felt visually elongated. This marked Kirby's latest footwear-forward look on the â€œFantastic Four: First Stepsâ€ press tour. Earlier this week in Paris, she wore metallic wraparound stilettos with a lilac Givenchy halter dress. In Mexico, she styled two different Manolo Blahnik silhouettes â€” including the black snakeskin Paloma heel â€” with cutout knits and a teal Schiaparelli gown. And at the Alabama trailer launch in February, she wore pointed PVC stilettos with vintage Versace. Across each appearance, Kirby has relied on heels with clean lines and exaggerated finishes â€” think eye-catching metallics, sheer panels and snakeskin â€” to ground dresses that range from architectural to body-conscious. â€œThe Fantastic Four: First Stepsâ€ marks the Marvel franchise's official reboot under Disney, introducing a new cast led by Kirby, Pedro Pascal, Joseph Quinn and Ebon Moss-Bachrach.
